intro: Zauschneria latifolia var. arizonica, commonly known as the Arizona coast goldpoppy, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils along coastal areas and has a low, sprawling growth habit. Its leaves are broad and lance-shaped, and it produces showy, cup-shaped blooms in early spring. This variety is known for its adaptability to arid conditions and is often found in coastal dunes and sandy flats.
